snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo promised to change a system in which employees who mistreated disabled and mentally ill patients rarely lost their jobs, but two years later, little has changed.
abstract: New York State lags on terminating workers who abuse disabled patients, despite Gov Andrew M Cuomo's pledge to change the system; only 23 percent of workers recommended for dismissal by the state in 2012 actually ended up being fired, because of weaknesses in arbitration process, permissive attitude of state officials and aggressive stance of public sector labor unions.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo promised to change a system in which employees who mistreated disabled and mentally ill patients rarely lost their jobs, but two years later, little has changed.
